result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Alston

records.addlTxt: Proposed order Signed and Filed.  Copies given to deputy for Sheriff's dept.

Defendant Kevin Alston in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Kevin Alston.  Assistant District Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The court is in receipt of the Doctor's report.
The parties are not challenging the report.
Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed pursuant to Wisc. stat. 971.14(4) and ordered the proceedings suspended. The court has also determined that the defendant may regain his competency in the statutory period of time.  
The court ordered the defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff's Department.  The court ordered the Sheriff's Department to transfer the defendant FORTHWITH to state facility to be determined for an examination and any treatment deemed appropriate.

Case adjourned for return of report in Br 45    MN
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Order for Competency Evaluation, Signed, filed and forwarded to forensic unit.

Defendant Kevin Alston appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Kevin Alston.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense counsel informs the court that she believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court suspended proceedings, and ordered defendant remanded  for an outpatient examination by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. 

Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 45.  mn.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 8:30am

Defendant Kevin Alston not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Kevin Alston.  Prosecuting attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for the State of Wisconsin for ADA Michael Schindhelm.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Case adjourned for scheduling in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Alston in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor. Defendant Kevin Alston in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Kevin Alston appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. Schimmels. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45, Judge Kies.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with EYM; FM;TM; Any Citizen witness indicated criminal complaint 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kevin Alston in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Kevin Alston in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Alston appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
